metadata.title: CVE-2015-7837 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: The Linux kernel, as used in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, kernel-rt, andEnterprise MRG 2 and when booted with UEFI Secure Boot enabled, allowslocal users to bypass intended securelevel/secureboot restrictions byleveraging improper handling of secure_boot flag across kexec reboot.

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-raspi').
linux-aws package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support').
linux-azure package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in focal is affected and needs fixing.

linux-azure-fde: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-azure-fde-5.15').
linux-azure-fde-5.15 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-bluefield package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp-5.15 package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gkeop: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-gkeop-5.15: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
